metadata.title: CVE-2018-6156 on Ubuntu 18.04 LTS (bionic) - high
metadata.description:
Incorect derivation of a packet length in WebRTC in Google Chrome prior to68.0.3440.75 allowed a remote attacker to potentially exploit heapcorruption via a crafted video file.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2018-6156` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

firefox - 70.0+build2-0ubuntu0.18.04.1
firefox-geckodriver - 70.0+build2-0ubuntu0.18.04.1
firefox-mozsymbols - 70.0+build2-0ubuntu0.18.04.1
No subscription required

chromium-browser - 68.0.3440.75-0ubuntu0.18.04.1
chromium-browser-l10n - 68.0.3440.75-0ubuntu0.18.04.1
chromium-chromedriver - 68.0.3440.75-0ubuntu0.18.04.1
chromium-codecs-ffmpeg - 68.0.3440.75-0ubuntu0.18.04.1
chromium-codecs-ffmpeg-extra - 68.0.3440.75-0ubuntu0.18.04.1
No subscription required

criterions.comment: firefox package in bionic was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '70.0+build2-0ubuntu0.18.04.1').
chromium-browser package in bionic was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '68.0.3440.75-0ubuntu0.18.04.1').
